com.digev.fw.exception

Class GException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.digev.fw.exception.GException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GError, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationException, AuthorizationException, InvalidConfigurationException

    public class GException
extends java.lang.Exception
implements GError
    Default Exception class for Digital Evolution products. In addition to standard Java Exception features, this class also allows an error code and problem context to be saved with the exception. The error code is an indexable key that can be used to look up trouble shooting information. The context is information about the problem that caused the exception specific to the point of execution at which the problem occured. The type of context data provided is specific to the type of exception being thrown. The context of the problem is represented using an Object array. The interpretation of these objects is the responsibility of the exception handler.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected java.lang.String getAdditionalErrorMsg()
      Deprecated. 
      Use setContext(Object[]) instead.
      java.lang.Object[] getContext()
      Returns the context of the exception (if any).
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Deprecated. 
      The description should is now independent from the GException class. Use getErrorCode() and then use ErrorCodeBundle.getMessageKey(int) to get the key of the description message. From there use the ResourceBundle configured for the system.
      static java.lang.String getDescription(long _nId)
      Deprecated. 
      The description should is now independent from the GException class. Use ErrorCodeBundle.getMessageKey(int) to get the key of the description message. From there use the ResourceBundle configured for the system.
      java.lang.String getDetails()
      Deprecated. 
      Due to the support of message keys, localized messages, and the additional context associated with GExceptions, it is no longer as simple as calling one method to return a detailed message. Please read the documentation for GException to learn guidelines for generating such a message.
      ErrorCode getErrorCode()
      Returns the error code associated with this exception.
      long getErrorID()
      Deprecated. 
      Please use getErrorCode() instead.
      java.lang.String getErrorNumber()
      Deprecated. 
      The time an exception is thrown is no longer stored with the exception. The time it takes to catch a thrown exception should be negligable so it becomes the rsponsibilty of the exception handler to note the current time. The formatting of times according to locales or timezones is also no longer part of GException. Use the standard java.text.DateFormat class for that.
      static java.lang.String getInfoFromThrowable(java.lang.Throwable _t)
      Deprecated. 
      Please use Throwable.getStackTrace() instead.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GException

        public GException(ErrorCode errorCode)
        Constructs the exception with an error code. Error codes can provide a convenient search index for end-users when researching solutions to reported problems. The error code can also be used as an index to finding a message key for finding a descriptive message about the problem, however that is outside the scope of the this class.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - ErrorCode that represents the problem being reported.

      • GException

        public GException(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Deprecated. Please use GException(ErrorCode, Throwable) instead.
        Constructs an exception caused by another exception.
        Parameters:
        cause - The cause as a Throwable (which is saved for later retrieval by the getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

      • GException

        public GException(ErrorCode errorCode,
                  java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs an exception caused by another exception and an error code identifying the new problem. See GException(int) for more information about error codes.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - ErrorCode of the problem being reported.
        cause - The cause as a Throwable (which is saved for later retrieval by the getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

      • GException

        public GException(ErrorCode errorCode,
                  java.lang.Object[] context)
        Constructs the exception with an error code. Error codes can provide a convenient search index for end-users when researching solutions to reported problems. The error code can also be used as an index to finding a message key for finding a descriptive message about the problem, however that is outside the scope of the this class.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - ErrorCode that represents the problem being reported.
        context - Object[] holding context objects, null if no context available.

      • GException

        public GException(ErrorCode errorCode,
                  java.lang.Object[] context,
                  java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs an exception caused by another exception and an error code identifying the new problem. See GException(int) for more information about error codes.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - ErrorCode of the problem being reported.
        context - Object[] holding context objects, null if no context available.
        cause - The cause as a Throwable (which is saved for later retrieval by the getCause() method). (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorCode

        public ErrorCode getErrorCode()
        Returns the error code associated with this exception. Error codes can provide a convenient search index for end-users when researching solutions to reported problems. The error code can also be used as an index to finding a message key for finding a descriptive message about the problem, however that is outside the scope of the this class.
        Specified by:
        getErrorCode in interface GError
        Returns:
        ErrorCode of the problem being reported.

      • setErrorCode

        public void setErrorCode(ErrorCode errorCode)
        Changes the error code. Error codes can provide a convenient search index for end-users when researching solutions to reported problems. The error code can also be used as an index to finding a message key for finding a descriptive message about the problem, however that is outside the scope of the this class.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - ErrorCode of the problem being reported.

      • getContext

        public java.lang.Object[] getContext()
        Returns the context of the exception (if any). The context is information about the problem that caused the exception specific to the point of execution at which the problem occured. The type of context data provided is specific to the type of exception being thrown. The context of the problem is represented using an Object array. The interpretation of these objects is the responsibility of the exception handler.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface GError
        Returns:
        Object[] holding context objects, null if no context available.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(java.lang.Object[] context)
        Changes the context of the exception. The context is information about the problem that caused the exception specific to the point of execution at which the problem occured. The type of context data provided is specific to the type of exception being thrown. The context of the problem is represented using an Object array. The interpretation of these objects is the responsibility of the exception handler.
        Parameters:
        context - Object[] holding context objects, null if no context available.

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage()
        Deprecated. 
        Messages are not obtained directly from the GException class. Instead, the errror code can be used as a key look up a message, however that is outside the scope of this class.
        Overrides:
        getMessage in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        Empty String.

      • getLocalizedMessage

        public java.lang.String getLocalizedMessage()
        Returns the localized message corresponding to the exception's error code. The code is not localized during construction. See localize(MessageSource) for localizing a GException.
        Specified by:
        getLocalizedMessage in interface GError
        Overrides:
        getLocalizedMessage in class java.lang.Throwable
        Returns:
        Localized error code message, The error code itself is returned if the exception has not been localized.

      • setLocalizedMessage

        protected void setLocalizedMessage(java.lang.String message,
                                   java.util.Locale locale)
        Changes the localized message for the exception. The locale the message was localized to must also be supplied.
        Parameters:
        message - Localized error code message.
        locale - Locale used to localize the message.

      • getLocale

        public java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Returns the locale the exception has been localized to, if at all.
        Specified by:
        getLocale in interface GError
        Returns:
        Locale the exception has been localized to, null if not localized.

      • getRootCause

        public java.lang.Throwable getRootCause()
        Returns the root cause of the exception. There may be several nested causes of one exception. This method will return the very first, root cause. If this exception was not caused by any other problem, then this method will return this exception as the root cause.
        Specified by:
        getRootCause in interface GError
        Returns:
        Throwable representing the root cause of the exception. This may be this exception itself if it was not caused by anything else.

      • getRootErrorCode

        public ErrorCode getRootErrorCode()
        Returns the root error code of the exception. There may be several nested causes of one exception. This method will return the very first, root cause error code. Since the root of the problem may not be a GException, the deepest GException will be used to return the error code. If the deepest GException is this object, then this object's error code will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getRootErrorCode in interface GError
        Returns:
        ErrorCode of the deepest GException in the cause stack.

      • localize

        public boolean localize(MessageSource messages,
                        java.util.Locale locale)
        Localizes the exception using a MessageSource. If any causes in the exception have not been localized, they will be localized at this time.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface GError
        Parameters:
        messages - MessageSource that provides access to messages based on error codes and a locale.

      • localize

        public boolean localize(MessageSource messages)
        Localizes the exception using a MessageSource. If any causes in the exception have not been localized, they will be localized at this time.
        Specified by:
        localize in interface GError
        Parameters:
        messages - MessageSource that provides access to messages based on error codes and a locale.

        public java.lang.String getVerboseMsg()
        Deprecated. Due to the support of message keys, localized messages, and the additional context associated with GExceptions, it is no longer as simple as calling one method to return a verbose message. Please read the documentation for GException to learn guidelines for generating such a message.

      • getErrorNumber

        public java.lang.String getErrorNumber()
        Deprecated. The time an exception is thrown is no longer stored with the exception. The time it takes to catch a thrown exception should be negligable so it becomes the rsponsibilty of the exception handler to note the current time. The formatting of times according to locales or timezones is also no longer part of GException. Use the standard java.text.DateFormat class for that.
